result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan R. Durbin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse Assessments, Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to: Any Sentence currently serving.
Concurrent with: Probation is concurrent on Ct 3, Ct 4 and Ct 5 as are the conditions thereof unless otherwise specified.

miscConds.notes: Restitution to be held open for 60 days

Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample, within 48 hours, for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.   Defendant is to pay costs, fines, surcharges or fees directly to and will be collected by the Clark County Clerk of Court.    Defendant granted a payment plan of $50.00 per month to begin 04/01/2023, to include 21CF91.

Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request  Defendant is to undergo a Domestic Violence Assessment and follow through with any recommendations.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.  Defendant shall not be in the presence or possession of drugs or drug paraphernalia, or consume any medication or drug except as may be specifically prescribed by a licensed Wisconsin medical professional for defendant, and then shall be taken only as prescribed. Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety.    The defendant shall have no contact with AB, LS, GB or NB unless approved by the Agent and the Victim of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.
The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.  The defendant shall submit to random urine/PBT testing as required by the agent or any law enforcement officer.
The defendant is to submit to an Alcohol and Other Drug Assessment (AODA) and follow the recommendations, releasing the findings to the agent.

timeConds.notes: Jail sentence is stayed until further Court order.  Jail sentence is on Ct 3 only.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ryan R. Durbin

records.addlTxt: Original Bond returned by Sherrif's Department unsigned / not posted.
Court requesting input from the State

09:00 AM Attorney Ellen Anderson appeared on behalf of the State and Defendant, Ryan R. Durbin, in custody, appeared with Attorney Matthew K Prior.  The defendant enters a plea of No Contest  The Court finds that the defendant has entered his plea, knowingly, intelligently and of his own free will and finds the defendant Guilty.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Ellen Anderson appeared on behalf of the State and Defendant, Ryan R. Durbin from the Clark County Jail, appeared with Attorney Matthew K Prior.   Defendant acknowledges receipt of the Information    The defense waived reading of the information and stood mute to the charges.

09:47 AM Attorney Ellen Anderson appeared on behalf of the State and Defendant, Ryan R. Durbin from the Clark County Jail, appeared with Attorney Matthew K Prior. Defense submitting a Preliminary hearing waiver.   Court goes through full colloquy of waiver of preliminary hearing with Defendant. Court finds probable cause and bounds over for trial. State to file an Information.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 12, 2022 at 09:45 am.

09:21 AM Attorney  appeared on behalf of the State and Defendant, Ryan R. Durbin, appeared by video from Clark County Jail with Attorney Matthew K Prior.  Defendant acknowledged receipt of complaint.  Waived reading of the complaint  Waived time limits for the preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Initial appearance on April 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.  Defendant shall not be in the presence or possession of drugs or drug paraphernalia, or consume any medication or drug except as may be specifically prescribed by a licensed Wisconsin medical professional for defendant, and then shall be taken only as prescribed.   The defendant shall have no contact with ALB, LHS, NLB, & GLB of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way. Defendant shall not be on or about the residence of the victims.

02:15 PM  All appeared through Zoom platform. Attorney Ellen Anderson appeared on behalf of the State and Defendant, Ryan R. Durbin appeared, pro se by video from the Clark County Jail.   Defendant acknowledged receipt of complaint.  Defendant advised of right to an attorney.  Initial appearance scheduled for April 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
